snippet: New findings show that money troubles interfere with the academic performance of about one-third of all college students, who report finances as a major source of stress.
abstract: Study by National Survey of Student Engagement shows that money troubles interfere with academic performance of about one-third of all college students, who report finances as major source of stress.
lead_paragraph: New findings show that money troubles interfere with the academic performance of about one-third of all college students, who report finances as a major source of stress.

headline.seo: Money Troubles Add to Students’ Burden Before Graduation, Study Finds
headline.main: Financial Worries Pile on Long Before Graduation
headline.print_headline: Financial Worries Pile On Long Before Graduation
